name: How to deal with text as data
body:
This repository contains the slides and code for the workshop on working with text as data for the Mozilla Festival 2013 in London.  If you have never cloned a git repository before, follow the bootcamp provided by GitHub: https://help.github.com/categories/54/articles

```
$ git clone https://github.com/rjweiss/mozfest2013.git
$ cd mozfest-2013-slides
$ bash serve.sh 
# this will open up a browser and start serving the slide show
```

### Authors and Contributors
Rebecca Weiss (@rjweiss) for the Mozilla Festival 2013

### Additional information
- Slides are HTML5 slides from Google: https://code.google.com/p/io-2013-slides/
- R scripts are distributed as [R Markdown](http://www.rstudio.com/ide/docs/authoring/using_markdown)
-- Unfortunately, there isn't a nice site like nbviewer.ipython.org...[yet](http://www.rstudio.com/shiny/)
- Python scripts are distributed [IPython notebooks](http://ipython.org/notebook.html)
-- If you can't run a Python IDE that can handle notebooks, try going to these links:
-- [Python classification gist](http://nbviewer.ipython.org/7158866)
-- [Python sentiment analysis gist](http://nbviewer.ipython.org/7158902)


### Recommended resources for the workshop
IDEs:
- RStudio (for R): http://www.rstudio.com/
- Canopy (for Python): https://www.enthought.com/products/epd/free/
-- also includes many useful Python dependencies
- IPython: http://ipython.org/install.html
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
